newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's ONCF railway '96 turnover at $159.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's ONCF railway '96 turnover at $159.5 mln.

text.p: Morocco's state-owned utility Office National des Chemins de Fer (ONCF) said on Tuesday it posted a turnover of 1.5 billion dirhams ($159.5 million) in 1996, up 5.6 percent from the previous year.
The increase is mainly attributed to an increase in transport of passengers and merchandise and goods freight.
"Net results for 1996 have improved thanks to rationalisation of finance management," the ONCF office said, but gave no further details.
The office's chairman Mohamed El Alj said that 1996 saw the go-ahead of an investment plan worth 5.2 billion dirhams financed by loans from foreign invesment institutions, including the World Bank.
The office will invest a total of 2.02 billion dirhams from its own funds, El-Alj said.
The investments aimed at upgrading the country's 2,000 km railway network, he said.
